TopicTitle: How to perform the rescue part of the rescue contract?

Articles.Content: Ok, I have a hitchhiker pod with 2 tourists, and room to hold 2 more. I am under 10m from the next contract, a rescue mission. How do I get the stranded kerbal from the debris, to the hitchhiker pod? I have tried "transfer", no dice. Do I need to risk jetpacking over to it lol?
get your ship with a distance 2km or less, then press [ or ] to switch focus, then EVA the poor man and move him/her to your ship, and then happy landing.
Ah ok. So I DO have to manually jetpack over. There is no button to do it? Guessing F5 will be my best friend there.....

Right. Moving the poor man to your ship needs to be controlled by you. To be more precise, you click EVA, then press Space to leave ladder, then press R to activate jetpack, then WASD{LShift}{LCtrl} to move. Shouldn't be harder than rendezvous as jetpack gives a decent acceleration and you don't need to worry about unaligned RCS CoT versus CoM. I actually think doing rescue is a good tutorial for rendezvous.
I like to get my ship within 100m as I prefer short EVA trips and it is not hard to get that close. I have been as close as 20m. I agree that doing a rescue is good practice for rendezvous/docking.
Distance in space is overrated, you can send a kerbal on EVA to rendezvous with a ship 20 kilometers away with no trouble

It's the EVA jetpack that is OP. I once encountered a bug that I can control a ship that hasn't been rescued (1st vessel in the save, save in KSC, then do quick load - you'll not switch to KSC but instead focus on your first ship, regardless of whether you have control or not). And it happened to be a high orbit ship to rescue - and I just EVA the poor man, get him to LKO with EVA jetpack only. 20km - oh that was a Ap~23000km orbit
